Stayed with kids
review_text: Do you like peace and quiet? What about comfortable accommodations? Beautiful surroundings and people that make you feel completely at home? If so, do yourself a favor and book this spot now! The magic of this beautifully decorated barn is not just the rustic decor but also the obvious care, warmth, and charisma the owners bring to the space. The interior is absolutely exquisite with hand-finished reclaimed wood planks on the walls, black and white checkerboard tile in the bathroom, and exposed rafters strung with lights you can switch on that make it look like you are sleeping under a starry sky. The open floor plan boasts delightfully comfy sofas and an amazing old-fashioned leather recliner, a retro dining table, a vintage piano to plink around on, plus a flat-screen TV complete with DVD player and WiFi. The kitchen has a full-sized fridge and sink, toaster oven, microwave, and Keurig coffee maker with all the fixings. The farmhouse bed is comfy and has plenty of pillows. The walk-in shower has excellent water pressure, plenty of hot water, and a tiled bench. Out back there is a patio perfect for grilling, complete with a table and umbrella for meals or just hanging out, and a chimenea. The chimenea is fully stocked and ready to go; it only took one match to light (seriously, it was impressive!). The salt-water pool out front is beautifully maintained, ranges from around 3 to 10 feet deep (with a diving board at the deep end), and has plenty of places to lounge and relax. The covered patio is perfect for long conversations day or night. I could go on and on, but the best part is that these folks are some of the best people you could hope to meet! Lois and Pam are thoughtful, considerate, good-hearted people who genuinely enjoy sharing their excellent venue with others. Bottom line: if you like taking it easy in beautiful natural surroundings and rustic luxury provided by a couple of amazing people, book this spot today!
